action.action-desc: Mrs. Bice of Oklahoma (for herself, Mr. Johnson of Louisiana, and Mr. Posey) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To amend title 37, United States Code, to exempt certain bonuses, incentive pay, and other benefits from repayment in the case of a member of the Armed Forces involuntarily separated for refusing to receive a vaccination against COVID–19.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Safeguarding Military Bonuses Act.

section.header: Special rule for discharges related to COVID–19
section.text: Section 373(b) of title 37, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Special rule for discharges related to COVID–19
paragraph.text: The Secretary concerned shall grant to an individual involuntarily separated from an Armed Force solely on the basis of the refusal of such individual to receive a vaccination against COVID–19 an exception to the requirement to repay a bonus, incentive pay, or similar benefit under subsection (a) if such bonus, incentive pay, or similar benefit was made before August 24, 2021.
